title: Carlisle vs Everton: Team news, kick-off time, probable line-ups, odds and stats for the FA Cup clash
title_page: Carlisle vs Everton:Â Team news, kick-off time, probable line-ups, odds and stats for the FA Cup clash | Daily Mail Online
text:
Ahead of this weekend's FA Cup action, Sportsmail will be providing you with all you need to know about every fixture, with team news, provisional squads, betting odds and Opta stats. Here is all the information you need for Everton's trip to League Two side Carlisle.
Team news
Carlisle
Hallam Hope will line up against the side he played more than 10 years for when Carlisle host Everton. The 21-year-old striker is on loan at Carlisle from Bury and could lead the line.
Midfielder Gary Dicker may also start the game despite holding talks over a move north of the border to Kilmarnock.
Provisional squad: Gillespie, Raynes, Ellis, Atkinson, Gillesphey, Dicker, Hery, Kennedy, Ibere, Hope, Wyke, Hanford, Bacon, Balanta, Gilliead, Comley, McQueen, Sweeney, Asamoah, Miller, Douglas, Joyce, Thompson
Carlisle United manager Keith Curle will welcome Everton to Brunton Park in the FA Cup
Everton
Kevin Mirallas will have a late fitness test on a tendon injury ahead of the trip.
Midfielder Muhamed Besic also missed the club's midweek Capital One Cup semi-final exit at Manchester City and will not be ready for this weekend.
Joel Robles will keep his place in goal, as has been the case for cup matches.
Provisional squad: Robles, Oviedo, Jagielka, Funes Mori, Galloway, Cleverley, McCarthy, Osman, Lennon, Kone, Pienaar, Howard, Stones, Baines, Pennington, Barry, Deulofeu, Lukaku, Rodriguez, McAleny.
Everton forward Kevin Mirallas will have a late fitness test on a tendon injury ahead of the trip
Key match stats (supplied by Opta)
CARLISLE v EVERTON Kick-off: Sunday, 1.30pm - BT Sport Odds (subject to change): Carlisle: 6/1 Draw: 19/5 Everton: 1/2 Referee: Lee Mason Managers: Keith Curle (Carlisle), Roberto Martinez (Everton
Everton have progressed in their last eight FA Cup ties against lower league opposition, scoring 26 goals in the process and conceding just five.
These sides have met three times in the FA Cup in the past, with Everton winning on each occasion (1930, 1968 and 2010).
Indeed, the Cumbrians have won just one of their last 14 FA Cup ties against top flight opposition, beating QPR 1-0 in January 1986 (D2 L11).
The Toffees have reached the fifth round of the FA Cup in four of the previous five seasons.
Romelu Lukaku has scored in all three of his FA Cup appearances for Everton.
